trans-unit.source: Provides a container for a collection of <xref href="System.Net.CookieCollection"></xref> objects.
A <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer> is a data structure that provides storage for instances of the <xref:System.Net.Cookie> class, and which is accessed in a database-like manner.
The <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer> has a capacity limit that is set when the container is created or changed by a property.
An instance of the <xref:System.Net.Cookie> class is added to the container based on its originating URI.
It is added to an internal <xref:System.Net.CookieCollection> associated with the URI.
A <xref:System.Net.Cookie> is retrieved from the container based on the URI as a <xref:System.Net.CookieCollection>, or as a string that can be used to submit HTTP WebRequests.

The <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer> has three properties that govern the volume of the content of the container: <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer.Capacity%2A>, <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer.MaxCookieSize%2A>, and <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer.PerDomainCapacity%2A>.
These values have the default settings of 300, 4096, and 20 respectively.

When a <xref:System.Net.Cookie> is added to the container, these properties are used to determine whether a <xref:System.Net.Cookie> already contained in the <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer> should be discarded to make room for the new one.

The <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer> keeps track of each addition to ensure that neither the <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer.Capacity%2A> nor the <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer.PerDomainCapacity%2A> limits are exceeded.
If one or both are exceeded, then <xref:System.Net.Cookie> instances held by the <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer> are removed.
First, any expired <xref:System.Net.Cookie> is removed.
If further capacity must be recaptured, then the least-recently used <xref:System.Net.CookieCollection> is purged.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Net.CookieContainer"></xref> class.
The default constructor initializes all fields to their default values.

<xref:System.Net.CookieContainer.DefaultCookieLimit> is used to initialize <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer.Capacity%2A>, <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer.DefaultCookieLengthLimit> is used for <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer.MaxCookieSize%2A>, and <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer.DefaultPerDomainCookieLimit> is used for <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer.PerDomainCapacity%2A>.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Net.CookieContainer"></xref> class with a specified value for the number of <xref href="System.Net.Cookie"></xref> instances that the container can hold.
<xref:System.Net.CookieContainer.PerDomainCapacity%2A> is initialized to 20, and <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer.MaxCookieSize%2A> is initialized to 4096.
The number of <xref href="System.Net.Cookie"></xref> instances that the <xref href="System.Net.CookieContainer"></xref> can hold.
capacity is less than or equal to zero.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Net.CookieContainer"></xref> class with specific properties.
The parameters specify values for <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer.Capacity%2A>, <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer.MaxCookieSize%2A>, and <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer.PerDomainCapacity%2A>.
The number of <xref href="System.Net.Cookie"></xref> instances that the <xref href="System.Net.CookieContainer"></xref> can hold.
The number of <xref href="System.Net.Cookie"></xref> instances per domain.
The maximum size in bytes for any single <xref href="System.Net.Cookie"></xref> in a <xref href="System.Net.CookieContainer"></xref>.
perDomainCapacity is not equal to .
and
(perDomainCapacity is less than or equal to zero or perDomainCapacity is greater than capacity).
maxCookieSize is less than or equal to zero.
Adds a <xref href="System.Net.Cookie"></xref> to a <xref href="System.Net.CookieContainer"></xref>.
This method uses the domain from the <xref href="System.Net.Cookie"></xref> to determine which domain collection to associate the <xref href="System.Net.Cookie"></xref> with.

If the <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer.Count%2A> property equals or exceeds the <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer.Capacity%2A> property, one or more <xref:System.Net.Cookie> instances are removed from the container before adding the `cookie` parameter.

Enough <xref:System.Net.Cookie> instances are removed to bring <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer.Count%2A> below <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer.Capacity%2A> as follows: if there are expired instances in the given scope, they are cleaned up.
If not, then the least recently used <xref:System.Net.CookieCollection> is found and removed from the container.
The <xref href="System.Net.Cookie"></xref> to be added to the <xref href="System.Net.CookieContainer"></xref>.
cookie is `null`.
The domain for cookie is `null` or the empty string ("").
cookie is larger than maxCookieSize.
-or-
the domain for cookie is not a valid URI.
Adds the contents of a <xref href="System.Net.CookieCollection"></xref> to the <xref href="System.Net.CookieContainer"></xref>.

If the <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer.Count%2A> property equals the <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer.Capacity%2A> property, one or more <xref:System.Net.Cookie> instances are removed from the container before adding the contents of the `cookies` parameter.
Enough <xref:System.Net.Cookie> instances are removed to make room for `cookies` as follows: if there are expired instances, they are cleaned up.
If not, or if more room is needed, then the least recently used <xref:System.Net.CookieCollection> is found and removed from the container.
The <xref href="System.Net.CookieCollection"></xref> to be added to the <xref href="System.Net.CookieContainer"></xref>.
cookies is `null`.
Adds a <xref href="System.Net.Cookie"></xref> to the <xref href="System.Net.CookieContainer"></xref> for a particular URI.
If you add a <xref:System.Net.Cookie> instance for just one specific host, do not set the <xref:System.Net.Cookie.Domain%2A> property of the <xref:System.Net.Cookie> instance.
This is set automatically, based on the URI.
If your URI corresponds to your local domain and sends to all the hosts on the local domain, set the <xref:System.Net.Cookie><xref:System.Net.Cookie.Domain%2A> property equal to ".local".
Otherwise, make sure it matches the host name used in the URI.

If the <xref:System.Net.Cookie.Version%2A> property of a <xref:System.Net.Cookie> is Netscape, the <xref:System.Net.Cookie.Path%2A> property of the <xref:System.Net.Cookie>, if not set explicitly, is derived from the URI and is the complete path from the URI, including the page name.

If the <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer.Count%2A> property equals the <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer.Capacity%2A> property, one or more <xref:System.Net.Cookie> instances are removed from the container before adding the `cookie` parameter.

Enough <xref:System.Net.Cookie> instances are removed to bring <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer.Count%2A> below <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer.Capacity%2A> as follows: if there are expired instances in scope, they are cleaned up.
If not, then the least recently used <xref:System.Net.CookieCollection> is found and removed from the container.
The URI of the <xref href="System.Net.Cookie"></xref> to be added to the <xref href="System.Net.CookieContainer"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Net.Cookie"></xref> to be added to the <xref href="System.Net.CookieContainer"></xref>.
uri is `null` or cookie is `null`.
cookie is larger than maxCookieSize.
-or-
The domain for cookie is not a valid URI.
Adds the contents of a <xref href="System.Net.CookieCollection"></xref> to the <xref href="System.Net.CookieContainer"></xref> for a particular URI.
If you add a <xref:System.Net.Cookie> instance for just one specific host, do not set the <xref:System.Net.Cookie.Domain%2A> property of the <xref:System.Net.Cookie> instance.
This is set automatically, based on the URI.
If your URI corresponds to your local domain and sends to all the hosts on the local domain, set the <xref:System.Net.Cookie><xref:System.Net.Cookie.Domain%2A> property equal to ".local".
Otherwise, make sure it matches the host name used in the URI.

If <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer.Count%2A> equals <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer.Capacity%2A>, one or more <xref:System.Net.Cookie> instances is removed from the container before adding the `cookie` parameter.

Enough <xref:System.Net.Cookie> instances are removed to bring <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer.Count%2A> below <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer.Capacity%2A> as follows: if there are expired instances in scope they are cleaned up.
If not, then the least recently used <xref:System.Net.CookieCollection> is found and removed from the container.
The URI of the <xref href="System.Net.CookieCollection"></xref> to be added to the <xref href="System.Net.CookieContainer"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Net.CookieCollection"></xref> to be added to the <xref href="System.Net.CookieContainer"></xref>.
cookies is `null`.
The domain for one of the cookies in cookies is `null`.
One of the cookies in cookies contains an invalid domain.
Gets and sets the number of <xref href="System.Net.Cookie"></xref> instances that a <xref href="System.Net.CookieContainer"></xref> can hold.
If <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer.Count%2A> equals or exceeds <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer.Capacity%2A>, one or more <xref:System.Net.Cookie> instances are removed from the container.

Enough instances are removed to bring <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer.Count%2A> below <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer.Capacity%2A> as follows: if there are expired <xref:System.Net.Cookie> instances in scope, they are cleaned up.
If not, then the least recently used <xref:System.Net.CookieCollection> is found and removed from the container.
<xref:System.Net.CookieContainer.Capacity%2A> must be greater than or equal to <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer.PerDomainCapacity%2A>.
The number of <xref href="System.Net.Cookie"></xref> instances that a <xref href="System.Net.CookieContainer"></xref> can hold.
This is a hard limit and cannot be exceeded by adding a <xref href="System.Net.Cookie"></xref>.
Capacity is less than or equal to zero or (value is less than and is not equal to ).
Gets the number of <xref href="System.Net.Cookie"></xref> instances that a <xref href="System.Net.CookieContainer"></xref> currently holds.
The default value of this property is <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer.DefaultCookieLimit>.
If <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer.Count%2A> equals or exceeds <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer.Capacity%2A>, one or more <xref:System.Net.Cookie> instances are removed from the container.

Enough instances are removed to bring <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer.Count%2A> below <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer.Capacity%2A> as follows: if there are expired <xref:System.Net.Cookie> instances in scope, they are cleaned up.
If not, then the least recently used <xref:System.Net.CookieCollection> is found and removed from the container.
The number of <xref href="System.Net.Cookie"></xref> instances that a <xref href="System.Net.CookieContainer"></xref> currently holds.
This is the total of <xref href="System.Net.Cookie"></xref> instances in all domains.
Represents the default maximum size, in bytes, of the <xref href="System.Net.Cookie"></xref> instances that the <xref href="System.Net.CookieContainer"></xref> can hold.
This field is constant.
The default maximum <xref:System.Net.Cookie> size is 4096.
Represents the default maximum number of <xref href="System.Net.Cookie"></xref> instances that the <xref href="System.Net.CookieContainer"></xref> can hold.
This field is constant.
The default maximum number of <xref:System.Net.Cookie> instances is 300.
Represents the default maximum number of <xref href="System.Net.Cookie"></xref> instances that the <xref href="System.Net.CookieContainer"></xref> can reference per domain.
This field is constant.
The default maximum number of <xref:System.Net.Cookie> instances per domain is 20.
Gets the HTTP cookie header that contains the HTTP cookies that represent the <xref href="System.Net.Cookie"></xref> instances that are associated with a specific URI.
<xref:System.Net.CookieContainer.GetCookieHeader%2A> returns a string that holds the HTTP cookie header for the <xref:System.Net.Cookie> instances specified by `uri`.
The HTTP header is built by adding a string representation of each <xref:System.Net.Cookie> associated with `uri`.
Note that the exact format of the string depends on the RFC that the <xref:System.Net.Cookie> conforms to.
The strings for all the <xref:System.Net.Cookie> instances that are associated with `uri` are combined and delimited by semicolons.
This string is not in the correct format for use as the second parameter of the <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer.SetCookies%2A> method.
The URI of the <xref href="System.Net.Cookie"></xref> instances desired.
An HTTP cookie header, with strings representing <xref href="System.Net.Cookie"></xref> instances delimited by semicolons.
uri is `null`.
Gets a <xref href="System.Net.CookieCollection"></xref> that contains the <xref href="System.Net.Cookie"></xref> instances that are associated with a specific URI.
A new instance of a <xref:System.Net.CookieCollection> is created.
Then the <xref:System.Net.Cookie> instances in the internal collection that are associated with the specified URI are read out and added to the new <xref:System.Net.CookieCollection>.
The URI of the <xref href="System.Net.Cookie"></xref> instances desired.
A <xref href="System.Net.CookieCollection"></xref> that contains the <xref href="System.Net.Cookie"></xref> instances that are associated with a specific URI.
uri is `null`.
Represents the maximum allowed length of a <xref href="System.Net.Cookie"></xref>.
If the new value of <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer.MaxCookieSize%2A> is less than the current value, any <xref:System.Net.Cookie> with a length that exceeds the new value will be truncated.
The maximum allowed length, in bytes, of a <xref href="System.Net.Cookie"></xref>.
MaxCookieSize is less than or equal to zero.
Gets and sets the number of <xref href="System.Net.Cookie"></xref> instances that a <xref href="System.Net.CookieContainer"></xref> can hold per domain.

If the new <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer.PerDomainCapacity%2A> value is less than the current value, and if any of the domain collections contain more <xref:System.Net.Cookie> instances than the new value, the collections are pruned to fit.
This uses the same basic rules as described in the <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer.Capacity%2A> property.
However, this does the clean-up only on the collection for this domain.
The number of <xref href="System.Net.Cookie"></xref> instances that are allowed per domain.
PerDomainCapacity is less than or equal to zero.
-or-
(PerDomainCapacity is greater than the maximum allowable number of cookies instances, 300, and is not equal to ).
Adds <xref href="System.Net.Cookie"></xref> instances for one or more cookies from an HTTP cookie header to the <xref href="System.Net.CookieContainer"></xref> for a specific URI.

<xref:System.Net.CookieContainer.SetCookies%2A> pulls all the HTTP cookies out of the HTTP cookie header, builds a <xref:System.Net.Cookie> for each one, and then adds each <xref:System.Net.Cookie> to the internal <xref:System.Net.CookieCollection> that is associated with the URI.
The HTTP cookies in the `cookieHeader` string must be delimited by commas.
The URI of the <xref href="System.Net.CookieCollection"></xref>.
The contents of an HTTP set-cookie header as returned by a HTTP server, with <xref href="System.Net.Cookie"></xref> instances delimited by commas.
cookieHeader is `null`.
One of the cookies is invalid.
-or-
An error occurred while adding one of the cookies to the container.
